lines.text: Equals about 9.81 m/s<sup class="">2</sup> on Earth

secText:
Lesson:
1. Define [OBJ:expsec_c372:freefall acceleration]. Understand that freefall acceleration has different values around the universe.
2. Understand that [OBJ:expsec_c373:freefall acceleration is constant] using examples and experiments as evidence.
3. Work through a sample problem to [OBJ:app_identify_v_a_freefall_question:determine the direction of velocity and freefall acceleration in a vacuum].
4. Work through a sample problem to [OBJ:app_calc_peak_time_height_question:calculate displacement using freefall acceleration].

In-class assessment:
1. [OBJ:qc_37424:Calculate] freefall acceleration.
2. [OBJ:qc_37425:Calculate] velocity using freefall acceleration.
